title: Strange-Flavor Mixed Nuts
source: The Book of Sichuan Chili Crisp - Jing Gao
categories: The Book of Sichuan Chili Crisp - Jing Gao
ingredients: - ½ tsp Ground Roasted Sichuan Pepper
- ½ lb / 225g assorted nuts (cashews, peanuts, almonds, pecans)
directions: 1. In a small bowl, mix together the kosher salt, chili powder, and roasted Sichuan pepper. Set aside.2. Prepare a baking pan for cooling the nuts.3. In a large wok or pot over high heat, combine water and sugar. Stir continuously with a spatula as the mixture bubbles and thickens, about 15 minutes, until it reaches 250°F / 120°C on a candy thermometer.4. Immediately remove from heat. Quickly add the nuts and spice mixture to the hot syrup and fold them together until evenly coated, forming small clusters.5. Spread the nuts in a flat layer on the prepared baking pan and let cool for a few hours. Best enjoyed after resting for a full day.
